Meryl Streep.passage: Meryl Streep is an American actress and philanthropist who has been widely regarded as one of the greatest actresses of all time. Born on June 22, 1949, in Summit, New Jersey, Streep began her acting career in the late 1960s and has since appeared in numerous films, television shows, and stage productions. Streep attended Vassar College and Yale University, where she studied drama and earned a Master of Fine Arts degree. She made her professional stage debut in 1971 and quickly gained recognition for her performances in productions such as "The Cherry Orchard" and "A Memory of Two Mondays." In 1977, she made her film debut in "Julia" and received her first Academy Award nomination for her supporting role. Throughout the 1980s, Streep continued to establish herself as one of the most talented actresses of her generation, earning critical acclaim for her performances in films such as "The French Lieutenant's Woman," "Sophie's Choice," and "Out of Africa." She won her first Academy Award for Best Actress for her role in "Sophie's Choice" in 1983. Streep's career continued to flourish in the 1990s and 2000s, with notable performances in films such as "The Bridges of Madison County," "The Devil Wears Prada," and "Doubt." She has been nominated for a record-breaking 21 Academy Awards, winning three, and has also won eight Golden Globe Awards and two Screen Actors Guild Awards. In addition to her acting career, Streep has been a vocal advocate for various social and political causes, including women's rights, environmentalism, and the arts. She has served on the board of the Sundance Institute and has been a supporter of the National Women's History Museum. Streep has also been recognized for her philanthropic work, including her support of the Silver Mountain Foundation for the Arts, which provides scholarships and grants to aspiring artists. In 2014, she was awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom by President Barack Obama for her contributions to the arts and humanities. Overall, Meryl Streep's talent, dedication, and philanthropy have made her a beloved and respected figure in the entertainment industry and beyond.

Leonardo DiCaprio.passage: Leonardo DiCaprio is an American actor, film producer, and environmental activist. He was born on November 11, 1974, in Los Angeles, California. DiCaprio began his acting career in the early 1990s, appearing in television commercials and guest-starring on several television shows, including "Roseanne" and "Growing Pains." He gained recognition for his role as Toby Wolff in the 1993 film "This Boy's Life," which also starred Robert De Niro. DiCaprio's breakthrough role came in 1997 when he starred as Jack Dawson in James Cameron's epic romance "Titanic." The film was a massive commercial success, grossing over $2 billion worldwide and earning DiCaprio his first Academy Award nomination for Best Actor. He went on to receive four more Oscar nominations for his performances in "The Aviator" (2004), "Blood Diamond" (2006), "The Wolf of Wall Street" (2013), and "Once Upon a Time in Hollywood" (2019). In addition to his acting career, DiCaprio is also a dedicated environmental activist. He founded the Leonardo DiCaprio Foundation in 1998, which supports environmental causes and promotes sustainability. He has also produced several documentaries about climate change, including "Before the Flood" (2016) and "Ice on Fire" (2019). DiCaprio has been recognized for his philanthropic work and activism, receiving the Clinton Global Citizen Award in 2013 and the Crystal Award at the World Economic Forum in 2016. He was also appointed as a United Nations Messenger of Peace in 2014, with a focus on climate change. Despite his success and fame, DiCaprio has remained relatively private about his personal life. He has been linked to several high-profile actresses, including Gisele BÃ¼ndchen and Blake Lively, but has never been married. He is known for his love of art, and has an extensive collection of works by artists such as Jean-Michel Basquiat and Pablo Picasso. Overall, Leonardo DiCaprio is a talented actor and committed environmental activist who has made a significant impact in both the entertainment industry and the world at large.

Viola Davis.passage: Viola Davis is an American actress and producer who has won numerous awards for her work in film, television, and theater. Born on August 11, 1965, in St. Matthews, South Carolina, Davis grew up in poverty and experienced racism and discrimination throughout her childhood. Despite these challenges, she developed a love for acting and pursued it as a career. Davis attended Rhode Island College and later the Juilliard School in New York City, where she honed her craft and developed her skills as an actress. She began her career in theater, performing in numerous productions on and off Broadway, including August Wilson's "Seven Guitars" and "King Hedley II." Her performances earned her critical acclaim and several awards, including a Tony Award for Best Featured Actress in a Play for her role in "King Hedley II." In the early 2000s, Davis began to transition to film and television, appearing in supporting roles in movies such as "Traffic" and "Antwone Fisher." She also had recurring roles on television shows like "Law & Order: Special Victims Unit" and "City of Angels." However, it was her performance in the 2008 film "Doubt" that brought her widespread recognition and critical acclaim. She received an Academy Award nomination for Best Supporting Actress for her role as Mrs. Miller, a mother whose son is accused of sexual misconduct. Davis continued to build her career in film and television, appearing in movies such as "The Help," "Prisoners," and "Fences," for which she won an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress. She also starred in the television series "How to Get Away with Murder," for which she won an Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actress in a Drama Series. In addition to her acting work, Davis is also a producer, having founded her own production company, JuVee Productions, with her husband, Julius Tennon. The company focuses on producing films and television shows that feature diverse voices and perspectives. Throughout her career, Davis has been a vocal advocate for social justice and equality, using her platform to speak out on issues such as racism, sexism, and poverty. She has also been recognized for her philanthropic work, including her support of organizations such as Hunger Is and the Vaseline Healing Project. Overall, Viola Davis is a talented and accomplished actress and producer who has made a significant impact on the entertainment industry and beyond.

Tom Hanks.passage: Tom Hanks is an American actor and filmmaker who has had a successful career in Hollywood spanning over four decades. He was born on July 9, 1956, in Concord, California, and grew up in a Mormon family. Hanks attended California State University, Sacramento, but dropped out to pursue acting. Hanks began his acting career in the late 1970s, appearing in low-budget films and television shows. He gained recognition for his role in the television series Bosom Buddies (1980-1982), which led to his first major film role in Splash (1984). Hanks' breakthrough role came in the 1988 film Big, for which he received his first Academy Award nomination for Best Actor. Throughout the 1990s, Hanks became one of the most sought-after actors in Hollywood, starring in a string of critically acclaimed and commercially successful films. He won back-to-back Academy Awards for Best Actor for his performances in Philadelphia (1993) and Forrest Gump (1994). Other notable films from this period include A League of Their Own (1992), Sleepless in Seattle (1993), Apollo 13 (1995), and Saving Private Ryan (1998). In addition to his acting career, Hanks has also worked as a producer, writer, and director. He made his directorial debut with the 1996 film That Thing You Do!, which he also wrote and starred in. He has since directed several other films, including Larry Crowne (2011) and Greyhound (2020). Hanks has received numerous awards and accolades throughout his career, including four Golden Globe Awards, two Screen Actors Guild Awards, and the Presidential Medal of Freedom. He is also known for his philanthropic work, particularly his support of veterans and their families. In recent years, Hanks has continued to work in film and television, appearing in projects such as Captain Phillips (2013), Bridge of Spies (2015), and A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood (2019). He is widely regarded as one of the greatest actors of his generation and a Hollywood icon.

Brad Pitt.passage: William Bradley Pitt, better known as Brad Pitt, is an American actor and film producer. He was born on December 18, 1963, in Shawnee, Oklahoma, and raised in Springfield, Missouri. Pitt attended the University of Missouri, where he studied journalism and advertising before dropping out to pursue a career in acting. Pitt's breakthrough role came in 1991 when he played a cowboy hitchhiker in the road movie Thelma & Louise. He went on to star in a string of successful films, including A River Runs Through It, Legends of the Fall, and Interview with the Vampire. In 1995, he starred in the crime thriller Seven, which cemented his status as a leading man in Hollywood. Pitt's career continued to flourish in the 2000s, with notable roles in films such as Ocean's Eleven, Troy, and Mr. & Mrs. Smith. He received critical acclaim for his performances in The Curious Case of Benjamin Button and Moneyball, both of which earned him Academy Award nominations for Best Actor. In addition to his acting career, Pitt is also a successful film producer. He founded the production company Plan B Entertainment in 2001, which has produced films such as The Departed, 12 Years a Slave, and Moonlight, all of which won the Academy Award for Best Picture. Pitt has been recognized for his contributions to the film industry with numerous awards, including two Golden Globe Awards and an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor for his role in Once Upon a Time in Hollywood. He is also known for his philanthropic work, particularly his support of environmental causes and his work with the Make It Right Foundation, which builds affordable and sustainable homes for people in need. Pitt's personal life has also been the subject of media attention. He was married to actress Jennifer Aniston from 2000 to 2005 and later married actress Angelina Jolie in 2014. The couple, who have six children together, filed for divorce in 2016. Despite the ups and downs of his personal life, Pitt remains one of the most respected and sought-after actors in Hollywood. With a career spanning over three decades, he has established himself as a versatile and talented performer, as well as a savvy producer and philanthropist.

Jolie has been married three times, first to actor Jonny Lee Miller, then to actor Billy Bob Thornton, and finally to actor Brad Pitt. She has six children, three of whom were adopted internationally. Emma Watson.passage: Emma Watson is an English actress, model, and activist. She was born on April 15, 1990, in Paris, France, to British parents. Watson rose to fame at the age of 11 when she was cast as Hermione Granger in the Harry Potter film series, which spanned over a decade and consisted of eight films. Watson's performance in the Harry Potter films earned her critical acclaim and numerous awards, including the Young Artist Award and the National Movie Award for Best Female Performance. She also became one of the highest-paid actresses in the world, earning over $60 million for her work in the Harry Potter franchise alone. After the Harry Potter series ended, Watson continued to act in films such as The Perks of Being a Wallflower, The Bling Ring, and Beauty and the Beast. She also became a fashion icon, modeling for brands such as Burberry and LancÃ´me. In addition to her acting and modeling career, Watson is also an activist for gender equality and women's rights. In 2014, Watson was appointed as a UN Women Goodwill Ambassador and launched the HeForShe campaign, which aims to engage men and boys in the fight for gender equality. She has also spoken out about issues such as sexual harassment and the gender pay gap. In 2019, Watson co-founded the sustainable fashion brand, Good On You, which rates fashion brands on their environmental and ethical practices. Watson has received numerous accolades for her activism, including the Britannia Award for British Artist of the Year and the MTV Trailblazer Award. She was also named one of Time magazine's 100 most influential people in the world in 2015. Overall, Emma Watson is a talented actress, model, and activist who has made a significant impact in the entertainment industry and beyond. Her dedication to promoting gender equality and sustainability has inspired many and cemented her as a role model for young people around the world.

Reese Witherspoon.passage: Laura Jeanne Reese Witherspoon (born March 22, 1976) is an American actress, producer, and entrepreneur. She is the recipient of several accolades, including an Academy Award, a Primetime Emmy Award, a BAFTA Award, a Screen Actors Guild Award, two Golden Globe Awards, and two Critics' Choice Awards. Witherspoon is one of the highest-paid actresses in the world, as of 2019. Born in New Orleans, Louisiana, and raised in Nashville, Tennessee, Witherspoon began her career as a child actress, making her professional screen debut in The Man in the Moon (1991), for which she was nominated for a Young Artist Award. Following breakout roles in Desperate Choices: To Save My Child (1992) and Jack the Bear (1993), she starred in the comedy-drama Pleasantville (1998), for which she won the Young Hollywood Award for Breakthrough Performance. Her leading role of Tracy Flick in Election (1999) was nominated for a Golden Globe Award. Witherspoon's breakthrough role came in 2001 with the box office hit Legally Blonde, in which she played Elle Woods, a fashion merchandising major who decides to become a law student in order to follow her ex-boyfriend to Harvard Law School. The film was a commercial success and established Witherspoon as a leading actress in Hollywood. She reprised the role in the 2003 sequel Legally Blonde 2: Red, White & Blonde. Witherspoon's other notable films include the drama The Good Lie (2014), the crime thriller Wild (2014), for which she received an Academy Award nomination for Best Actress, and the HBO drama series Big Little Lies (2017â2019), for which she won a Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actress in a Limited Series or Movie. In addition to her acting career, Witherspoon is a producer and entrepreneur. She founded the production company Pacific Standard in 2012, which produced the films Gone Girl (2014), Wild (2014), and Hot Pursuit (2015). In 2015, she launched the retail brand Draper James, which sells clothing, accessories, and home decor inspired by her Southern upbringing. Witherspoon has been married twice. She was married to actor Ryan Phillippe from 1999 to 2007, with whom she has two children. She married talent agent Jim Toth in 2011, with whom she has one child.

Denzel Washington.passage: Denzel Hayes Washington Jr. (born December 28, 1954) is an American actor, director, and producer. He has received two Golden Globe awards, one Tony Award, and two Academy Awards: Best Supporting Actor for the historical war drama film Glory (1989) and Best Actor for his role as corrupt detective Alonzo Harris in the crime thriller Training Day (2001). Washington first rose to prominence in the 1980s with his portrayal of Dr. Phillip Chandler on the NBC medical drama St. Elsewhere. He then went on to star in a number of successful films, including Cry Freedom (1987), Malcolm X (1992), The Hurricane (1999), and Remember the Titans (2000). In addition to his acting career, Washington has also directed and produced several films. He made his directorial debut with the drama film Antwone Fisher (2002), which he also produced. He has since directed and produced several other films, including The Great Debaters (2007) and Fences (2016). Washington is known for his powerful and intense performances, often portraying complex and morally ambiguous characters. He has been praised for his ability to bring depth and nuance to his roles, and for his commanding presence on screen. Throughout his career, Washington has been recognized for his contributions to the entertainment industry. In 2016, he was awarded the Cecil B. DeMille Award at the Golden Globe Awards, in recognition of his outstanding contributions to the world of entertainment. He has also been honored with a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame, and has been inducted into the American Theater Hall of Fame. Beyond his work in film and television, Washington is also known for his philanthropic efforts. He has been involved with a number of charitable organizations, including the Boys & Girls Clubs of America and the Fisher House Foundation, which provides housing for military families. He has also been a vocal advocate for social justice and civil rights, and has spoken out on issues such as police brutality and racial inequality. Overall, Denzel Washington is widely regarded as one of the greatest actors of his generation, and his contributions to the entertainment industry and society as a whole have been significant and far-reaching.

She has since starred in a number of other successful films, including "Silver Linings Playbook" (2012), for which she won the Academy Award for Best Actress, "American Hustle" (2013), "Joy" (2015), and "Passengers" (2016). She has also been involved in various charitable organizations, including the World Food Programme and the Thirst Project. Despite her success, Lawrence has been open about the challenges she has faced in the entertainment industry, including issues with body image and the gender pay gap. She has been a vocal advocate for equal pay and has spoken out about the need for more diverse representation in Hollywood. Overall, Jennifer Lawrence has become one of the most influential and beloved actresses of her generation, known for her talent, charisma, and commitment to making a positive impact in the world.

Cate Blanchett.passage: Catherine Elise Blanchett, commonly known as Cate Blanchett, is an Australian actress and theatre director. She was born on May 14, 1969, in Ivanhoe, Victoria, Australia. Blanchett is one of the most acclaimed actresses of her generation, known for her versatility and range in both dramatic and comedic roles. She has won numerous awards, including two Academy Awards, three Golden Globe Awards, and three British Academy Film Awards. Blanchett began her acting career in the early 1990s, working primarily in theatre. She made her film debut in the 1997 Australian film "Paradise Road," but it was her role as Queen Elizabeth I in the 1998 film "Elizabeth" that brought her international recognition. Blanchett's performance in the film earned her a nomination for the Academy Award for Best Actress, and she went on to win the award for her role in the 2004 film "The Aviator." Blanchett has since appeared in numerous films, including "The Lord of the Rings" trilogy, "The Curious Case of Benjamin Button," "Blue Jasmine," and "Thor: Ragnarok." She has also worked extensively in theatre, both as an actress and a director. In 2008, she co-directed the Sydney Theatre Company's production of "A Streetcar Named Desire," in which she also starred as Blanche DuBois. In addition to her acting and directing work, Blanchett is also known for her humanitarian efforts. She is a Goodwill Ambassador for the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR), and has been involved in numerous campaigns to raise awareness about the plight of refugees around the world. Blanchett has been praised for her intelligence, grace, and talent, and is widely regarded as one of the greatest actresses of her generation. She continues to work in film, theatre, and television, and is known for her commitment to her craft and her dedication to social causes.

Robert De Niro.passage: Robert De Niro Jr. (born August 17, 1943) is an American actor, producer, and director. He is particularly known for his roles in crime films and thrillers, and is widely regarded as one of the greatest actors of his generation. De Niro has won numerous awards throughout his career, including two Academy Awards, a Golden Globe Award, and a Screen Actors Guild Award. De Niro was born in Manhattan, New York City, to a family of Italian and Irish descent. His father was a painter and sculptor, and his mother was a poet and painter. De Niro grew up in the Greenwich Village neighborhood of Manhattan, and attended the Fiorello H. LaGuardia High School of Music & Art and Performing Arts. He later studied at the Stella Adler Conservatory and the Lee Strasberg Theatre and Film Institute. De Niro's first major film role was in the 1973 crime drama "Mean Streets," directed by Martin Scorsese. He went on to collaborate with Scorsese on several other films, including "Taxi Driver," "Raging Bull," and "Goodfellas." De Niro's performances in these films are widely regarded as some of the greatest in cinema history. In addition to his work with Scorsese, De Niro has appeared in numerous other films throughout his career. Some of his notable roles include Michael Vronsky in "The Deer Hunter," Jake LaMotta in "Raging Bull," Sam Rothstein in "Casino," and Max Cady in "Cape Fear." De Niro has also directed several films, including "A Bronx Tale" and "The Good Shepherd." De Niro has been recognized for his contributions to the film industry with numerous awards and honors. In addition to his Academy Awards, Golden Globe, and Screen Actors Guild Award, he has also received the AFI Life Achievement Award, the Kennedy Center Honors, and the Presidential Medal of Freedom. Outside of his acting career, De Niro is also known for his philanthropic work. He is a co-founder of the Tribeca Film Festival, which was established in the wake of the September 11 attacks to revitalize the downtown Manhattan neighborhood. De Niro is also a vocal advocate for environmental causes and has been involved in numerous campaigns to raise awareness about climate change. Overall, Robert De Niro is widely regarded as one of the greatest actors of his generation, and his contributions to the film industry have been recognized with numerous awards and honors.

Johansson continued to work steadily in film throughout the early 2000s, appearing in a variety of genres and earning critical acclaim for her performances in films such as Lost in Translation (2003) and Girl with a Pearl Earring (2003). She also began to branch out into music, releasing her debut album Anywhere I Lay My Head in 2008. Johansson has also been involved in various philanthropic and political causes throughout her career. In 2018, she withdrew from a role in the film Rub & Tug following controversy over her casting as a transgender man. She has been named one of the highest-paid actresses in the world by Forbes magazine multiple times, and has been recognized for her fashion sense and style. Daniel Radcliffe.passage: Daniel Radcliffe is an English actor and producer who rose to fame for his portrayal of the titular character in the Harry Potter film series. Born on July 23, 1989, in London, Radcliffe began acting at a young age and made his acting debut in the BBC One television film, David Copperfield, in 1999. However, it was his role as Harry Potter in the film adaptation of J.K. Rowling's best-selling book series that catapulted him to international stardom. Radcliffe's portrayal of Harry Potter in the eight-film series, which spanned over a decade, earned him critical acclaim and numerous awards. He was praised for his ability to bring the beloved character to life on the big screen, capturing both his vulnerability and strength. Radcliffe's success as Harry Potter also led to other acting opportunities, including roles in the films The Woman in Black, Kill Your Darlings, and Swiss Army Man. In addition to his acting career, Radcliffe has also been involved in various philanthropic endeavors. He has been a vocal supporter of various charities, including The Trevor Project, which provides crisis intervention and suicide prevention services to LGBTQ+ youth, and Demelza Hospice Care for Children, which provides care and support to children with life-limiting illnesses and their families. Radcliffe has also been open about his struggles with alcoholism and mental health issues, using his platform to raise awareness and reduce the stigma surrounding these topics. He has spoken candidly about his experiences and has encouraged others to seek help when needed. In recent years, Radcliffe has continued to work in both film and television, showcasing his versatility as an actor. He starred in the TBS comedy series, Miracle Workers, and the Netflix limited series, Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt: Kimmy vs. the Reverend. He also appeared in the films Guns Akimbo and Escape from Pretoria. Overall, Daniel Radcliffe has established himself as a talented actor and a compassionate advocate for important causes. His contributions to the entertainment industry and his commitment to making a positive impact on the world have earned him a place in the hearts of fans around the globe.

Charlize Theron.passage: Charlize Theron is a South African and American actress and producer. She was born on August 7, 1975, in Benoni, South Africa. Theron grew up on a farm outside of Johannesburg and attended the National School of the Arts in Johannesburg. She began her career as a model and moved to the United States in the early 1990s to pursue acting. Theron's breakthrough role came in 1997 when she played the lead in the film "The Devil's Advocate" opposite Al Pacino and Keanu Reeves. She went on to star in a number of successful films, including "Mighty Joe Young" (1998), "The Cider House Rules" (1999), and "The Italian Job" (2003). In 2003, Theron won the Academy Award for Best Actress for her role in the film "Monster." She played the real-life serial killer Aileen Wuornos, and her performance was widely praised by critics. Theron also won a Golden Globe and a Screen Actors Guild Award for her role in the film. Theron has continued to work in both film and television, and has received numerous accolades for her performances. She has been nominated for two more Academy Awards, for her roles in "North Country" (2005) and "Bombshell" (2019). Theron has also won a number of other awards, including a BAFTA Award, a Critics' Choice Award, and a SAG Award. In addition to her acting career, Theron is also a producer. She founded the production company Denver and Delilah Productions in 2003, and has produced a number of films and television shows, including "Monster," "Young Adult" (2011), and "The Old Guard" (2020). Theron is also known for her philanthropic work. She is a UN Messenger of Peace and has worked with a number of organizations, including the Charlize Theron Africa Outreach Project, which focuses on HIV prevention in Africa. Overall, Charlize Theron is a talented actress and producer who has made a significant impact on the entertainment industry. Her performances have been widely praised, and she has received numerous awards and nominations for her work. Theron's philanthropic work also demonstrates her commitment to making a positive impact on the world.

Yale University..passage: Yale University is a private Ivy League research university located in New Haven, Connecticut. Founded in 1701 as the Collegiate School, it is the third-oldest institution of higher education in the United States and one of the nine Colonial Colleges chartered before the American Revolution. Yale College became Yale University in 1887, when it was renamed in recognition of a gift from the philanthropist John William Sterling. The university has three major academic components: Yale College (the undergraduate program), the Graduate School of Arts and Sciences, and the professional schools. Yale has a strong tradition of undergraduate education, with over 5,000 undergraduate students and a student-to-faculty ratio of 6:1. The university is known for its strong programs in law, business, medicine, and the humanities, and is consistently ranked among the top universities in the world. World Food Programme..passage: The World Food Programme (WFP) is the food-assistance branch of the United Nations and the world's largest humanitarian organization addressing hunger and promoting food security. According to the WFP, it provides food assistance to an average of 91.4 million people in 83 countries each year. From its headquarters in Rome and more than 80 country offices around the world, the WFP works to help people who are unable to produce or obtain enough food for themselves and their families. It is a member of the United Nations Development Group and part of its executive committee. The WFP was first established in 1961 after the 1960 Food and Agricultural Organization (FAO) Conference, when George McGovern, director of the US Food for Peace Programmes, proposed establishing a multilateral food aid programme. Ontario..passage: Ontario is a province located in east-central Canada, the largest by population and second largest, after Quebec, in total area. Ontario is bordered by the province of Manitoba to the west, Hudson Bay and James Bay to the north, and Quebec to the east and northeast, and to the south by the U.S. states of Minnesota, Michigan, New York, Ohio, and Pennsylvania. Almost all of Ontario's 2,700 km (1,678 mi) border with the United States follows inland waterways: from the west at Lake of the Woods, eastward along the major rivers and lakes of the Great Lakes/Saint Lawrence River drainage system. These include Rainy River, Pigeon River, Lake Superior, St. Marys River, Lake Huron, St. Clair River, Lake St. Clair, Detroit River, Lake Erie, Niagara River, Lake Ontario and the St. Lawrence River from Kingston, Ontario, to the Quebec boundary just east of Cornwall, Ontario. There is only about 1 km (0.6 mi) of land border made up of portages including Height of Land Portage on the Minnesota border. Ontario is sometimes conceptually divided into two regions, Northern Ontario and Southern Ontario. The great majority of Ontario's population and arable land is in the south. In contrast, the larger, northern part of Ontario is sparsely populated with cold winters and heavy forestation.

Pretoria is contained within the City of Tshwane Metropolitan Municipality as one of several constituent former administrations (among which also Centurion and Soshanguve).
